body:
The GRID system is based on CSS Grid. 

To know the basics about css grid visit this link: https://www.w3schools.com/css/css_grid.asp

Using Grid with qTags

Doing grids in Quanta is easy, thanks to qTags. 

By adding grid parameters to your qTags, in facts, you can create complex layouts without even writing a single line of CSS.

A grid in Quanta has 12 columns by default. 

Each element (qTag) contained inside a grid can have a customized  position, column span, row span, etc. 

Any element (including the body) having the class "grid" will become a 12-columns grid by default.

By setting this class, the element becomes a grid container, and direct sons will be the grid cells. A grid cell, can of course be a grid itself.


Grid attributes - reference chart

The grid system in Quanta is thought mobile-first - so the default definitions (column span, etc.) will apply to all resolutions, from mobile on. Then you can define two different definitions for tablet / medium screens (md) and desktop/laptop/large screens (lg), as follows:


Attribute name (css class)Description
gridMakes the qTag a "grid" (12x12 by default) 
grid-span-XDefines the column span of the grid 
grid-span-md-XDefines the column span of the grid in MEDIUM screens
grid-span-lg-XDefines the column span of the grid in LARGE screens
grid-row-span-X
Defines the row span of the grid
grid-row-span-md-X
Defines the row span of the grid in MEDIUM screens
grid-row-span-lg-X
Defines the row span of the grid in LARGE screens
p-0Defines a zero-padding cell item



Examples

A grid example with a LIST qtag:

[LIST|showtag|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:fruits]

[LIST|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:fruits]


A grid example with BLOG qtag:

[BLOG|showtag|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:fruits]

[BLOG|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:fruits]


A grid example with LIST qtag and a style template:

[LIST|showtag||tpl=image_title_linked|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:animals]

[LIST||tpl=image_title_linked|grid=grid|grid_list_item=grid-span-4:animals]
